attributes.action: Stop funding the BBC with taxpayer money
attributes.background: The BBC does not represent the public fairly anymore, it is a biased Corporation that is over funded with taxpayer money.

attributes.action: Legalise the permanent removal of front number plates.
attributes.background: As an avid car modifier and petrolhead, I and most people know find that the front number plates on our vehicles can really stand out more than we want and slightly ruin the look and aesthetic of the vehicle.
attributes.additional_details: The ability to permanently remove the front number plate could also reduce the risk of number plate theft by criminals as there are less possibilities. People say that it gives more opportunities for crime to be committed using the car but if the police never chase from the front so their DVLA scanners would still be able to correctly operate. The issue of speed cameras could be resolved by simply making them double sided so that they can capture criminals from both sides of the road.

attributes.action: Making it law to label foods containing group 1 carcinogens with warnings.
attributes.background:
Group 1 carcinogens are know to cause cancer like cigarettes for example.

Most people do not know that group 1 carcinogens are in many common foods.

A label stating that the product contains group 1 carcinogens gives the consumer the awareness and power to make a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details:
As stated by WHO;

Cancer prevention
Between 30-50% of all cancer cases are preventable. Prevention offers the most cost-effective long-term strategy for the control of cancer. National policies and programmes should be implemented to raise awareness, to reduce exposure to cancer risk factors and to ensure that people are provided with the information and support they need to adopt healthy lifestyles.

http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs297/en/

attributes.action: Stop the sale of cot bumpers in the UK
attributes.background: Cot bumpers are extremely dangerous and have taken innocent childrens lives. They are not needed and most of them are made to be pretty to entice you to buy them.

attributes.action: Legislate so that for each creation of life peers, males do not exceed females
attributes.background: A Parliament that reflects the diversity of the population would be better able to represent the people. Every government since the 1950s has appointed twice as many male life peers than female. This needs to be addressed.
attributes.additional_details:
The proportion of women in the House of Lords (26%) is lower than in every other parliament and assembly in the UK. 
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/LLN-2018-0015

Legislation exists to seat female bishops as Lords Spiritual preferentially, to address historic gender discrimination. 
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/LLN-2017-0056

attributes.action: Free dental care for UK University Students whilst in full-time education
attributes.background: UK University students over the age of 19 currently have to pay for dental care. This is very expensive and students already have the burden of paying for rent, food, college material and travel. Paying an excessive amount for dental care is off-putting and deprives some from getting essential care.

attributes.action: Scrap tuition fees for paramedic science and nursing degrees
attributes.background:
Tuition fees for students studying in England are £9250 a year regardless of the course being studied and the expected salary.
This means that students studying degrees such as nursing or paramedic science who will largely go into the NHS where salaries are capped are having to incur huge debts
attributes.additional_details:
Tuition fees were supposed to be a way of ensuring students who went on to earn higher salaries by virtue of their degree paid by the tax payer. Yet this now includes nurses and paramedics who have to have a degree rather than learning the skills on the job with time out for classroom based learning. 
They also have their salaries capped by the government and at the same time there are a shortage of nurses and paramedics who are essential to the smooth running of the NHS.

attributes.action: Issue legal guidance that IVA completion certificates should be issued promptly
attributes.background: An IVA makes people live on a tight budget for 5 years in an effort to pay back what they can. These people can't start to rebuild their lives or their credit rating until they get their completion certificate. This currently takes months and sometimes over 6 months. We suggest it should be 30 days.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.iva.co.uk/iva-completion-certificates-petition

attributes.action: Ban the removal of non farmed fresh water course fish for use as food.
attributes.background: Fresh water fish are now on the decline due a number of reasons from Cormarants, Otters and people from Cultures where removal and eating of course fish is acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
As a lifelong angler along with many other friends we have noticed many rivers,ponds lakes ect around Lincolnshire and Yorkshire have started to see a large decline in fish populations.
To counteract and help towards this we aim to start this petition to stop humans taking course fish from any waters unless specifically bred for the table for the period of 10 years with then a revue on the progress.
We feel this gives fish stocks a slightly better chance to help halt the decline in many venues.

attributes.action: Make asking for sex or sexual acts for rent a criminal offence
attributes.background: UK landlords are using classified adverts to advertise 'Sex for Rent' arrangements, in which young, vulnerable, often homeless people are convinced into living with a landlord "rent" free, in exchange for sexual acts. This coercion cannot continue, particularly for those with no other choice.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is effectively incitement to prostitution and should be classified as such under Section 52 of the Sexual Offenders Act 2003. 
(https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/prostitution-and-exploitation-prostitution) 

For more information please watch this documentary:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p05y93q5

 Or read these articles:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/article/d6ad2e6d-2c72-4a35-9281-daaeedf029ee
https://www.rt.com/uk/384580-sex-abuse-rent-tenants/

attributes.action: Give an income tax break for carers and nurses to promote work in healthcare
attributes.background: Raising minimum wage has not been as helpful as hoped, the problem is that when it’s raised so is the competition at local supermarkets etc. Some care homes can not afford to raise further. Giving a tax benefit to carers and nurses would encourage and reward people who work in this industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Lots of local authorities pay rates to care homes that means they struggle to break even, some have to reduce staffing numbers to compensate putting people at extreme risk. Other operators that also support people who pay privately are able to work more effectively but still have to pay the minimum wage.

We could make it policy that all carers and nurses that work under a cqc registration for care would benefit. This would have an added impact by encouraging people to leave temp agencies

attributes.action: Conduct a full enquiry into the finacial failure of NCC and those responsible
attributes.background:
Northamptonshire county council have completely failed in their financial responsibilities.
 We would like a full transparent public enquiry into the failings who is responsible and why and how this happened, so it can prevented in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
With planned cuts likely to affect the vulnerable, we think everyone involved should be held responsible and those affected have clear answers as to how this happened.
What messures are the government going to take to provide basic human rights to those most likely to be affected?

attributes.action: Ban all gambling advertising on TV
attributes.background: Problem gambling cost this country up to 1.2 billion pounds per year according to official figures. It is also linked to mental health and homelessness. Along with smoking gambling adverts do not belong on the television. Many gambling adverts promote it as glamorous - this is highly irresponsible.

attributes.action: Make It Law That Cyclists Have To Have Insurance
attributes.background: Cyclists can cause accidents just like other road users! They have very little patience towards people that they share both cycle and footpaths with. They should be insured!

attributes.action: The environment to be taught as a compulsory subject throughout school life.
attributes.background: All the good we do now with regards to litter picking, recycling, and on environmental issues will be a complete waste of time if we do not start to educate everyone from the year dot. We need to stop the rot so that our future generations will make a better job of looking after our world.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the people reading this will never have known what it is like to be brought up in a clean and pristine country. If we want to change this for our future generations we have to start NOW, and as with everything in life it begins with education. Many children are shown and taught to do the right thing before they start school, sadly many more are not because their parents themselves were not taught. We urgently need to stop this repetitive cycle which is why l have started this petition.

attributes.action: Stop the ageist segregation in minimum wage. Living costs are all the same.
attributes.background: Their are four segratory categories to minimum wage. 16-17, 18-20, 21-24 and over 25. The hourly minimum difference between what a 16 year old can earn to a 25 year old is £3.63. If they were working a full time week consisting of 40 hours thats an overall anual difference of £6,969.60.
attributes.additional_details: For a 16 and 25 year old working full time, doing the same job on minimum wage their annual differential income is £6,969.60. The guardian quotes: “A single person living in Britain needs to earn at least £13,400 a year before tax to afford a basic but acceptable standard of living” however for a sixteen year old on minimum wage working 40 hours per week will earn an average anual salary of £8,064. That’s only 60.17% of what is recommended for a stable income and living.

attributes.action: Amnesty for T4 students who overstayed because of colleges closed by UK in 2014.
attributes.background: In 2014 to achieve the unrealistic target of net migration figure, the UKBA closed a large number of colleges and played with students’ future. They lost their tuition fees and many of them didn’t find a way to came out from this problem.
attributes.additional_details: Young people especially the students are the backbone of every economy in the world. Most of the overstayed students are good at English and are working part-time as well, to support themselves and the UK economy by paying taxes. They are just the victims of unrealistic Home Office targets. Many of them are now working in low paid jobs and the businesses are just abusing and exploiting them. Giving them amnesty will bring them into the taxpayer net, and yield millions of pounds in tax and national insurance and they will contribute to the UK economy.

attributes.action: To increase funding to Citizens Advice
attributes.background: With the growing demand on Citizens Advice and closure of other organisations. This means bigger work loads with reduced funding. To provide a more comprehensive service Citizens Advice need more funding

attributes.action: Change the crime of killing by drink driving to manslaughter.
attributes.background:
My dad at 13 years old lost his mother because someone got behind the wheel after drinking. This person served less than 3 years in prison.
Drink driving fits the definition of manslaughter, they may mean no malice but knowing the risk still choose to drive, so should be punished accordingly.
attributes.additional_details:
Causing death due to drink driving in the UK is sentenced as death by dangerous driving. The average custodial sentence for causing death by careless/dangerous driving was just under four years in 2015.
240 times a year someone is killed by a drink driver in the UK. This means nearly 5 times a week someone in the UK loses their mom, dad, child, partner or friend.
Being in a vehicle makes their sentence more lenient than manslaughter. That is not justice for those who lose their lives.

attributes.action: Make "Jerusalem" England's official national anthem by law
attributes.background: Two years ago, a bill passed the first reading backing the call to consider an official national anthem for the nation of England to be played for major UK and Commonwealth events. This petition builds on that bill, and humbly asks to make 'Jerusalem' the official national anthem of England.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-derbyshire-35296296, "MPs back calls for English national anthem". BBC News. London: BBC. 13 January 2016.

https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2015-16/englishnationalanthem.html, English National Anthem Bill 2015-16.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rT1HEXNI9c4, 'Jerusalem', the song in question.

attributes.action: Fund a 24-hour suicide text line
attributes.background: Many people suffer from severe anxiety and may not feel comfortable making phone calls to crisis teams or suicide helplines so they avoid calling which could put them in danger. Text lines could be quicker, easier and more comfortable for younger people as well as people with severe anxiety.
attributes.additional_details: ‘The share of device owners saying they make at least one voice call a week has dropped down from 96% to 75% over the past three years, according to research carried out by Ipsos Mori for Deloitte.’ Taken from The Guardian. This shows people are using phone calls less and less so making 24 hour text lines may make more people reach it for help when they need it. Texting is quicker but it can also help people feel more comfortable with opening up so they could be more honest to get the help needed.

attributes.action: Return the Road Fund Licence, back to weight of vehicle and NOT emissions.
attributes.background: Vehicle Road Fund licence was changed to a Green Tax with no public consultation.
attributes.additional_details: The Road Fund Licence or Car Tax as it is known was based on vehicle weight NOT emissions. It needs to be returned to this. The Government encouraged people to buy diesel cars, now they want them scrapped. That is not fair when diesels are more cost efficient. What puts more pollutants directly into the air? Air travel only been around for about 100 years but has done some damage.

attributes.action: Give local authorities a legal duty of care towards those waiting for housing
attributes.background: My son Lee had leukaemia, while in remission he was waiting to be housed by our council who failed to house him in time. Lee then passed away at my home from catching influenza when he should have been isolated from the public. I was suing my council but lost as we could not have our case heard.
attributes.additional_details: My solicitor and barrister thought I had a good chance of succeeding if all my evidence was heard first which then we could have proved a case of negligence.  However, the court decided that the council had no duty of care so they wouldn’t listen to all the evidence. Please sign this petition for future cases. If councils had a legal duty of care towards those on their housing waiting lists ALL of the evidence in this and similar cases would be heard and not decided before! Please see Ref: Court of Appeal court 75 applicants no B3/2015/1289 dated 11th April 2017 Lilian Darby versus London borough of Richmond upon Thames

attributes.action: require proactive cleansing of our sewers under section 94 of the water act 1991
attributes.background: Currently the countries sewers are not being inspected for 40 plus years leading to fat bergs blockages and restricted flows. Reactive cleaning after blockages is detrimental to our infrastructures ability to cope with additional housing
attributes.additional_details: Ofwat have stated it is acceptable for manholes not to be lifted for 40 plus years meaning no maintenance cleansing or attempt to keep flowing of our sewers. This leads to serious blockages and fat bergs - syphons need inspecting every two years pipework cleaning ever 8 to 10 years - this policy is detrimental to public health and is fundamentally irrational interpretation of the law, simple because no time limit to cleaning is present within the state this does not mean it removes common sense.

attributes.action: Legislate to make all sewage treatment plants into biomass digesters.
attributes.background: IThis has a number of benefits. Capping the tanks where the solid waste is digested would mean that less smell and methane (one of the worst greenhouse gases) is released into the atmosphere.  Instead it would be fed into the gas network reducing our reliance on imported or fracked gas.
attributes.additional_details: Raw sewage is also sprayed onto fields.  It still smells and is still releasing methane.  It is easily washed out and pollutes water and it has less benefit for the soil.  Processed sewage is drier and more composted.  There is little methane and and nutrients are locked inand are not so easily washed out therefore it feeds and conditions the soil. It can also be used all year round and not just on empty fields.

attributes.action: Get schools to teach life skills and how to handle emotions
attributes.background: Schools need to teach children more about how to handle their emotions. Talking to children about what to do with their feelings and how to express them without causing themselves harm. Also life skills, like managing money, building a career and learning how to start a life as an adult.
attributes.additional_details:
When leaving school, you have your grades, you have big plans about going to university and starting a life as an individual. But are schools teaching children what and where to go next? NO!
They don’t teach children what to do when they feel depressed, upset or handle their emotions. Self harm and suicide is on the rise! Schools can help this! 
They don’t teach children how to look into property and buying a house,  pay a bill and setting up direct debts. They NEED to teach life skills.

attributes.action: Fund a student railway discount card to lower costs
attributes.background: I am 17 years old, and I have to pay £6.70 a day to just get to school. This isn’t even including the cost of getting home. Why should I have to pay such an extortionate amount of money to go somewhere that I have to be by law?

attributes.action: Supermarkets to be legally obliged to sell high sugar cereals separately.
attributes.background: Some breakfast cereals increasingly resemble confectionery, with many types having versions containing chocolate. Many contain between 20-39% sugar, are packaged to appeal to children, and are advertised on children’s TV. Meanwhile, childhood obesity rates continue to climb.
attributes.additional_details:
Many children consume over half their recommended daily amount of sugar at breakfast (Public Health England 2017). 
1in 5 British children finishes primary school obese (NHS 2017).
Typical supermarket Corn Flakes contain about 10% sugar.
Typical confectionery bars contain 45-50% sugar.
The govt. should make supermarkets legally obliged to sell those breakfast cereals containing 20-40% sugar separately, in the confectionery aisle, away from other breakfast cereals.

attributes.action: Improve the transition from mental health child service to adult
attributes.background: As it stands the mental health services in the UK discharge young people at the age of 18 and in some cases even 17 and move them onto the adult services. This process is in most cases tricky and many get lost in the system. The system needs a change to help the people who need it.

attributes.action: Ensure British food standards are met in any free trade agreement with USA
attributes.background: Once 'Brexit' is complete the government will be able to seek its own Free Trade Agreements (FTAs) with other countries, most notably the USA. The USA use hormones in the rearing of their meat, Genetically Modified vegetables, and have low animal welfare requirements.
attributes.additional_details: We want all food in Britain to adhere to our standards. We do not want chicken that has been washed in chlorine, we do not want beef which has been injected with hormones, we do not want pigs who have suffered horrendous conditions to be allowed to arrive in the UK. Raising and management of animal products in this way goes against the values that the British public hold. We hold our government accountable for protecting these values.

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions for sickle cell anaemia patients
attributes.background: Incurable disease, it is a chronic blood disorder

attributes.action: Failure to pay a County Court Judgement results in a criminal offence.
attributes.background: I won a CCJ in civil dispute case. I was awarded £10,410.88. They failed to pay by the deadline summonsed by Court. High Court bailiffs have failed to retrieve the funds. This can happen to anyone. There is no protection in a civil dispute. I want the law to change to protect the public.

attributes.action: Award World War 2 Veterans a medal
attributes.background: We the undersigned request that HM Government issue a medal or other symbol of recognition to World War 2 Veterans on the 75th Anniversary of the ending of World War 2 in 2020.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for medicinal purposes
attributes.background:
Evidence has shown that the use of CBD products improve help in cancer patients, people who suffer from severe epilepsy’s, MS and Parkinson’s desease
It’s time for action

attributes.action: Don't ban single use plastic straws for disabled people.
attributes.background: People with no arms or extremely short arms, people paralysed from the neck down, people with severe arthritis,muscle wasting diseases,cerebral palsy, these are just some disabled people who NEED straws to stay hydrated, my list by no means covers every type of impairment where straws are necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Plain and simple, if you cannot use your arms then you NEED a straw. The evidence so far regarding the alternatives to plastic straws is, the biodegradable ones start degrading when you put them in a hot drink as to the wheat ones, glass ones are dangerous for those who may accidentally bite them, bamboo and other wooden types are not flexible enough, some of the alternatives also change the flavour of the drink.

attributes.action: Get Deaf Road Warning signs onto our streets.
attributes.background: I am the mother of a 9 year-old profoundly Deaf boy. It struck me when visiting Europe and my family in the US that many countries and states have Deaf road warning signs in areas near schools with Deaf children and young adults, as well as in the vicinity of homes with Deaf families.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 1 in every 1000 children is born with a severe or profound hearing loss. There are 11 million people with hearing loss across the UK, around one in six of the population. Deafness is the third most common disability in the world but you probably wouldn't spot a Deaf person in a crowd or know that a pedestrian has hearing loss.
The DSA handbook has warning signs for many things, deer crossing elderly people, schools and so on. A Deaf road warning sign is a glaring omission.

attributes.action: To increase the length of imprisonment for Voyeurism to a minimum of 2 years.
attributes.background: Victims who are put through this vile offence are life changing, physically and mentally. Their ability to trust is taken away & yet the offender will only receive a maximum of 2 years imprisonment - with a 3rd off if they plead guilty. This is not in anyway justice for victims.
attributes.additional_details:
Voyeurism is an offence under the Sexual Offences Act 2003.

This offence consists of somebody watching/filming victims doing a private act without their consent. This can then be distributed over fake porn sites, social media and across the internet for others sexual needs. 2 years is not justice!

A private act can be from bathing, using a toilet, anything you would deem as private and personal, and people do not deserve to have their privacy taken and publicly distributed without knowing.

attributes.action: Remove known sex offenders from area where victim lives
attributes.background: Convicted child sex offenders should not be allowed in the area where their victims live. Children who are sexually assaulted suffer - reliving the incident, not being able to sleep at night and having nightmares about the sex offender coming back.
attributes.additional_details: A sex offender recently got a suspended sentence, time in rehab and 10 years on the sexual offenders register. The judge just allowed him to go home, in the same area as his victim. This is utterly unacceptable. Little children deserve not to live in fear!

attributes.action: I want the employees' contracts with zero hours to disappear.
attributes.background:
I want the employees' contracts with zero hours to disappear.
Staff recruitment agencies and companies should be sanctioned if they do not hand over to employees the minimum work contract signed and job description.
attributes.additional_details: I want a normative act that clearly stipulates that work contracts with font size of rights and obligations, terms and conditions of minimum 10 and not written in very small letters, in order not to violate the employee's right to correct, complete and accurate information.

attributes.action: the UK calls on the Turkish government to cease its military attacks on Afrin.
attributes.background:
I'm writing to you with regard to the worrying developments in Afrin, in northern Syria following the intervention of the Turkish military. 
A distressing situation has resulted from the heavy, indiscriminate bombing by the Turkish jets and artillery in heavily populated civilian areas in Afrin.
attributes.additional_details:
For years Afrin had been the safe haven for thousands of refugees who fled from neighboring cities and towns during the tragic civil war in Syria.
Remembering the tragedy of Kobane, no one would want to happen again in Afrin. 
I urge you to take up this matter with fellow members of the UK Parliament, who should demand that the UK government calls on the Turkish government to cease its military attacks on Afrin. 
Thank you in anticipation of your urgent attention to this matter.

Yours sincerely

attributes.action: Pay nursing students whilst on placement in University
attributes.background: Nursing students whilst in University work full time with the NHS. For some people, the money that they get from the NHS and their loan isn’t even enough to cover their rent and living costs.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of student nurses get depressed, anxiety and are over tired because they put so much hard work into their nursing degrees especially from all the placements including night shifts. A lot more get stressed because they physically can’t afford to live due to overpriced student housing and then money to live off for the whole year. There is also transport to think about for nurses going to placement. Student nurses feel like they’re ‘cheap labour’ for the NHS which is awful and upsetting.

attributes.action: Animal abuse charges to be the same as human abuse charges
attributes.background: Murder is murder, assault is assault, physical abuse is physical abuse whether it is a human or an animal anyone found murdering or assaulting an animal should be punished the same as if they had murdered/assaulted a human to the maximum extent of the law.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of animals are killed murdered, brutally beaten, or left to starve to death. The sentencing for these offences is often a minimum Unlimited fine and/or 6 months. Help to stop animal suffering by signing our petition. 

Examples: - 
http://www.da4a.org/sport.htm
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/katy-gammon-solicitor-who-locked-3391542
https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/donald-trumps-son-game-hunting-photos/

attributes.action: Permit marriage outdoors without the requirement of a permanent structure
attributes.background: Permit UK citizens to marry under a non-religious legally binding ceremony, in England and Wales, in all outdoor spaces without the requirement of a physical permanent structure. Laws already exist in Scotland and Northern Island. I am calling for equality within all countries of the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Cyclists - Make it mandatory for bicycles to have registration license plates
attributes.background: After years driving on UK roads, it is a very widely known fact that it is very difficult for cyclists to be held accountable for their traffic offences, such as running through red traffic lights and riding recklessly on pavements putting pedestrians at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/11/08/40-cyclists-jump-red-light-in-30-seconds--video/ 
https://www.ft.com/content/d430ddc2-4936-11e8-8ae9-4b5ddcca99b3

attributes.action: Require hospitals to provide sufficient free staff parking for nurses
attributes.background: My friend, an amazing nurse, is forced to pay £24 per week to park at the hospital she works for. She only works 16hrs, yet a substantial percentage of her pay is used enabling her JUST to GO to work. Nurses are already ridiculously underpaid for their role in saving lives. How can this be fair?
attributes.additional_details: The NHS, particularly hospitals, are one of if not the busiest body of workers in the UK. Nurses work tirelessly 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to provide a service that treats over 1 million patients in just 36 hours. There is a critical shortage of nurses with 1 in 11 NHS posts currently unfilled. Nurses are important, and it makes no sense to charge them to be able to simply go into work. It’s unfair, its uneconomical, and it is clearly not helping in people staying within NHS employment.

attributes.action: Halt arms sales to Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has carried out indiscriminate airstrikes in Yemen which have resulted in thousands of civilian deaths.
attributes.additional_details: These have been allowed by the British government's licensing of £4.6bn of arms sales to the kingdom since the start of the Yemeni Civil War in 2015. Saudi Arabia's blockade of Yemen has also resulted in the worst humanitarian crisis in the world.

attributes.action: Provide more government funding to help our struggling hospices to survive.
attributes.background: Sue Ryder Foundation have said they are closing their hospice at Nettlebed. The local community are about to lose a much loved facility which in a unique way has provided help and support to cancer victims and their families for many years.

attributes.action: Amend Equality Act 2010 by adding a provision for "Other" characteristics.
attributes.background: Change discrimination legislation, by adding another protected characteristic to the Equality Act 2010, namely "Other": a characteristic not included in the act but including traits/features/qualities, which could potentially attract discriminatory behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the only characteristics on which it is unlawful to discriminate are age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation and pregnancy/maternity. 
However, there is no recourse for people discriminated because of their weight, tattoos or sociocultural affiliation. This petition aims to change this by adding an “Other” option and thus not allowing people to be discriminated because of who they are within the rigid boundaries of the law, to be determined by Judges upon hearing and reading the evidence.

attributes.action: Make Mobility allowance available from birth on need, remove age discrimination.
attributes.background: Mobility allowance is only available to people over the age of 3, over  two thousand children under the age of 3 are required to have bulky medical equipment or specialised support wheelchairs, and as such are at risk when travelling in unsuitable or potentially unsafe vehicles  for their needs.
attributes.additional_details: The government wants children under three to go to a charity to get funding for a Wheelchair Accessible Vehicle, this is discriminating against them on the grounds of age, and goes against the governments own policy published on 1 October 2012 that outlaws discrimination based on age, the requirement for a Wheelchair Accessible Vehicle should be base wholly on the need of the child and age should not be a qualifying factor, these children can effectively become housebound because of this policy.

attributes.action: Give the electorate a Referendum to make House of Lords wholly elected via PR
attributes.background: The House of Lords membership criteria belongs to previous centuries, the UK  electorate deserves a wholly elected 2nd Chamber. Elected using solely proportional representation as a method of checks & balances.
